intro: Gaultheria chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by bright red berries that are edible. Gaultheria chiriquensis thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions with well-drained acidic soils. Its aromatic leaves and ornamental value make it a notable species in horticultural collections.
